page.title: 05RELIGION
page.content: The entrance porch and font of St Nicholas's Church are of Norman date and could well have been here at the original Domesday survey.In the 19th century the church was known as St Peter's but documents giving the original dedication have been found. There is a regular attendance at all services which are supported by a large choir. In the graveyard there is an Imperial War Graves Commission graveyard for the New Zealand and Canadian soldiers who died in Brockenhurst hotels during the first World War when they were used as hospitals. Each year on Anzac Day there is a service attended by New Zealand High Commission representatives, the local British Legion and villagers.
